cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi SE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest along the Florida east coast, then turning north-northwest to track very near the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the central South Carolina coast (vicinity of Charleston-Beaufort area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Anclote River, Florida (Gulf side)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton, FL to South Santee River, SC (hurricane); North of South Santee River, SC to Surf City, NC (tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, Georgia coast, and South Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds highly likely (69% chance), with a 34% chance of sustained 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible as the center passes offshore Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge 7–11 ft possible from Sebastian Inlet FL to Edisto Beach SC, including Charleston Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated totals near 15 inches along the immediate coast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, rip currents, coastal flooding, and isolated tornadoes beginning late Friday.
